place_description: A community-centered bookstore in East Charlotte selling general interest new books.

reviews_data.review_text: Excellent independent bookstore. Has newsletter and author events and book clubs . Friendly staff. Also has gift items and a nice children's corner

Love this bookstore! Wonderfully curated selection, both adult and kids' collections. It has a great atmosphere and lots of book clubs and events for all kinds of readers. Thoughtful store design, coffee and tea, changing table and baby essentials in the bathroom.

I am participating in the Greater Charlotte book crawl, this was my first visit to this bookstore. It is a very spacious store. There is a wide variety of genres. There's even books for various hobbies, such as knitting crochet, photography, even kits for embroidery. There's even a space for kids with plenty of children's books and a seating area to read to children. There's even a free tasting of coffee and tea. I asked the person tending to the bookstore what is the process for local authors to get their book into the store; They told me that you must bring a copy of your book and they will look through it and see if it's worth having in the bookstore. I really like this space and the variety and hidden gem books, so I definitely see myself visiting this place more often. Also, please keep in mind that the area that this store is in it has very high traffic, and I was there before 5 o'clock traffic hit

Visited here today on a Sunday afternoon. I am a great lover of books so I was happy to see a new bookstore in the area. The likes,  I liked that there was so many books and cool crafts for kids. There was a nice selection of children's books and little do it yourself crafts for them to try. Also they had journals and an eclectic jewelry selection of earrings. There are comfy chairs to sit in and they have hot coffee available.  I didn't notice any charging outlets while there,  so it may not be the best place to charge your phone or laptop.  They are part of the upcoming book crawl with other local bookstores in the area. The only thing was I wanted to sit down enjoy my coffee and read the back of the book I had picked out to guage if it was something I would want to read. I felt the employee hovered a bit and I felt uncomfortable when the employee wanted to hold the book at the front.  I wanted to sit read the back cover and enjoy the coffee. It did  lessen the book expierence for me.
I did purchase a book I was more certain of , but  I would have liked to have felt comfortable enough and less pressured to decide if I wanted the other book or not. I'm thankful to see more bookstores in the area though and wish them success .
Blessings,
Pr. Michelle
Such a great place! Staff are very friendly and they have a great selection of books.
Absolutely wonderful bookshop!! I stopped by on a whim and was not disappointed. The worker behind the desk was lovely and was willing to answer any questions I had.
I always find a great read every time I come to Troubadour! Love the selection of books and cozy space. Their e-newsletter is great, too.

My daughter and I love this bookstore! She enjoys the kids area while I have time to shop and look around. The owner is great and every staff member I have interacted with is phenomenal. They also host a variety of bookclubs for a variety of genres. Please come and support this wonderful small business!
Very cute and a great selection of books and little gifts.
Fantastic selection of books and journals. Great location in Matthews, NC. Was able to find what I needed easily and was helped graciously by staff. Go check out this local bookstore!
Lovely staff and book selection!

What a delightful shop! The owners were friendly and greeted my husband and I when we arrived, asking if we needed any assistance. We browsed on our own, and found a great, well-curated selection. There's also a selection of bookish gifts, puzzles, cards, stickers, etc. My husband and I each found a book and I picked up a few stickers. We'll definitely be back in the future!
Promotes local authors. This place is awesome. Great small business to support.
This is a welcoming spot with an excellent selection of books from all the Best of 2024 lists. The children's area was exceptional. Please support them.

Great little bookstore. Titles are well curated so that nearly everything on the shelves is inviting you to pick it up and read it. I browsed for nearly a half hour and then asked for recommendations and the clerk was spot on. Bought a book for my wife who loves COTAR and she loves it. They have bookish gifts as well. I picked up a title for my daughter and myself and got a puzzle for the family. What I liked most is it wasn't pretentious. Sometimes small stores like this can seem snooty, but not Troubador. I'll be coming back often. Great addition to local independent bookstores.
Wonderful bookstore! Owner and staff are friendly and helpful, the store is comfy and well laid out, and great selection of books gifts.
Got a birthday gift from here. Great selection and can't wait to check the store for more!
This is such a beautiful independent bookstore. My little one absolutely loved the kids corner and the prices were super reasonable for our books. We can't wait to become regular customers!

Our family loved getting books in this adorable, new bookstore! The owner is so nice and is very passionate about books. We love what they did with the space and book selection - they have a wonderful kids section in the back and lots of comfortable chairs and sofas around the store. We will be coming here regularly!
This shop is a great addition to Easter Charlotte! It has a warm and welcome vibe and a great selection of books and gifts. I'll definitely be back!
The owner is awesome, this isn't some chain or corporate-owned bookstore. Beautiful store, great atmosphere, awesome selection!
Extremely nice owner and great book store with a lot of selection!
